title: How to Make Dark Chocolate Mousse

steps.headline: Blend the silken tofu until smooth.
Melt the dark chocolate and mix 25ml boiling water to it.
Transfer the unsweetened cocoa powder into a mixing bowl and add rest of the boiling water to it.
Grind the amount of sugar required.
Mix the cocoa powder mixture and the melted chocolate slowly bit by bit in order to avoid lumps and prepare chocolate ganache.
Add the prepared chocolate ganache to the tofu and blend till they mix well.
steps.description: Add sugar bit by bit according to taste.

steps.headline: Take four transparent bowls or cups.
steps.description: Add the chocolate mousse mixture to the small bowls or cups in equal quantity.

steps.headline: Set your mousse in the fridge for minimum 3 hours or until set.
After your mousse is ready, top and garnish it with chopped roasted nuts and serve chilled.

text: Blend the silken tofu until smooth.  Melt the dark chocolate and mix 25ml boiling water to it. Set it aside. Transfer the unsweetened cocoa powder into a mixing bowl and add rest of the boiling water to it. Set it aside. Grind the amount of sugar required.  Mix the cocoa powder mixture and the melted chocolate slowly bit by bit in order to avoid lumps and prepare chocolate ganache.  Add the prepared chocolate ganache to the tofu and blend till they mix well. Add sugar bit by bit according to taste. Take four transparent bowls or cups. Add the chocolate mousse mixture to the small bowls or cups in equal quantity. Set your mousse in the fridge for minimum 3 hours or until set.  After your mousse is ready, top and garnish it with chopped roasted nuts and serve chilled.  Finished.
